alert.note: Alert for Northwest Pocahontas; Northwest Randolph; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 18 at 3:33AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...SNOW SHOWERS TO PRODUCE TRAVEL DIFFICULTIES THROUGH SUNRISE... Snow showers will continue overnight tonight, with 1 to 3 inches of snow accumulation expected by Sunday morning. Localized amounts of around 4 inches are possible along the higher windward slopes. These snow showers, combined with temperatures falling into the teens, could result in slippery travel, especially on bridge decks, ramps, and other elevated surfaces. In addition, the combination of wind and temperatures will produce wind chills in the single digits either side of zero tonight into Sunday morning. Be prepared for the potential of rapidly changing pavement conditions the remainder of the night, and allow extra time to reach your destination. Also allow for plenty of stopping distance.

area.areaDesc: Northwest Pocahontas; Northwest Randolph; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster
